text:
Alberto Ongaro (22 August 1925 – 23 March 2018), also known by his pseudonym Alfredo Nogara, was an Italian journalist, writer and comics writer. He was born in Venice, Italy. He also worked for "Il Corriere dei Piccoli". As a journalist, he has been a foreign correspondent of "L'Europeo", and he also wrote historical and adventure books, including "La taverna del doge Loredan" (1980), "La partita" (1986) and the latest "Il ponte della solita ora" (2006).
Ongaro died on 23 March 2018 in Venica of pneumonia at the age of 92.
